å·®å””å¤š9æˆéƒ½æœ‰å ±

The people of Hong Kong have neither obligations nor authority to define what is internal and what is not. They only need to make their demands clear, which they have done.

If Carrie Lam has the least amount of conscience, which she has shown repeatedly that she has not, she could have solved the problems. What if, as CE of Hong Kong, she declares that the bill is withdrawn, an independent investigation will be conducted, and so on?

We don't need to be reminded of her many bosses. But will Beijing come out and denounce her? If so, let them try !
